segments.pli: “Tayome, bhikkhave, dhammā attabyābādhāyapi saṃvattanti, parabyābādhāyapi saṃvattanti, ubhayabyābādhāyapi saṃvattanti.
segments.en: “These three things, mendicants, lead to hurting yourself, hurting others, and hurting both.
Bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo dhammā attabyābādhāyapi saṃvattanti, parabyābādhāyapi saṃvattanti, ubhayabyābādhāyapi saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These are three things that lead to hurting yourself, hurting others, and hurting both.

segments.pli: Tayome, bhikkhave, dhammā nevattabyābādhāyapi saṃvattanti, na parabyābādhāyapi saṃvattanti, na ubhayabyābādhāyapi saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These three things, mendicants, don’t lead to hurting yourself, hurting others, or hurting both.
Good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo dhammā nevattabyābādhāyapi saṃvattanti, na parabyābādhāyapi saṃvattanti, na ubhayabyābādhāyapi saṃvattantī”ti.
segments.en: These are three things that don’t lead to hurting yourself, hurting others, or hurting both.”
